Class CustomerDAO

java.lang.Object
ehubicka.Database.CustomerDAO
public class CustomerDAO extends Object
Used for accessing the customers table in the MySql database.

    • getDivisionID

      public static int getDivisionID(String division) throws SQLException
      Get the corresponding division ID from a division name.
      Parameters:
      division - is the division name to be passed in as a String.
      Returns:
      the corresponding division ID.
      Throws:
      SQLException - for errors related to interacting with the database.

    • insertCustomer

      public static void insertCustomer(String customerName, String address, String postalCode, String phone, String division, String country)
      Insert a new customer record into the database.
      Parameters:
      customerName - is the name of the customer.
      address - is the address of the customer.
      postalCode - is the postal code of the customer.
      phone - is the phone number of the customer.
      division - is the first-level-division of the customer.
      country - is the country of the customer.

    • update

      public static void update(int customerId, String customerName, String address, String postalCode, String phone, String division, String country)
      Modify an existing record of a customer in the database.
      Parameters:
      customerId - is the unique customer id for the customer (primary key).
      customerName - is the name of the customer.
      address - is the address of the customer.
      postalCode - is the postal code of the customer.
      phone - is the phone number of the customer.
      division - is the first-level-division of the customer.
      country - is the country of the customer.

    • deleteCustomer

      public static int deleteCustomer(int customerId) throws SQLException
      Remove an existing record of a customer in the database.
      Parameters:
      customerId - is the unique customer id for the customer (primary key).
      Returns:
      how many records were removed. Essentially verifies that a customer record was deleted.
      Throws:
      SQLException - for database errors.
